adiutor-toggle-adiutor: Use Adiutor to moderate, triage, and maintain content tasks
adiutor-desc: Adiutor is a MediaWiki extension to moderate, triage, and maintain content tasks on Wikipedia. It implements content triage methods and prioritizes and categorizes requests and content based on urgency and importance. Its user interface simplifies complex processes, making Wikipedia maintenance more accessible and efficient for users of all skill levels.
adiutor-beta-feature-description: Adiutor is a MediaWiki extension to moderate, triage, and maintain content tasks on Wikipedia. It implements content triage methods and prioritizes and categorizes requests and content based on urgency and importance. Its user interface simplifies complex processes, making Wikipedia maintenance more accessible and efficient for users of all skill levels.
adiutor-beta-feature-enabled: Adiutor is now enabled as a beta feature.
adiutor-protect-against-rebuilding-help: When chosen, the re-creation protection tag prompts administrators to apply creation protection if the page is consistently recreated.
adiutor-rationale-placeholder: Why are {{GENDER:|you}} nominating this page for deletion?
adiutor-inform-creator: Inform the user who created the page.
adiutor-inform-creator-help: If selected, the user who created this page will be notified.
adiutor-prd-deletion-type-2: BLP PROD (Proposed deletion of unsourced BLPs)
adiutor-prd-deletion-type-2-help: Proposed deletion of entirely unsourced biographies of living individuals, following the guidelines stated in $1.
adiutor-rpp-incomplete-request-details: Please ensure you have selected a duration and a type and provided a rationale.
adiutor-rpm-incomplete-request-details: Please ensure you have enter a new name and provided a rationale.
adiutor-csd-header-description: Please select the appropriate reason for the deletion of this page from the options below. If the reason for the speedy deletion request does not meet the criteria for speedy deletion, the page may not be deleted.
adiutor-rpp-header-description: This module is for requesting that a page, file or template be protected. Please read up on the protection policy.
adiutor-prd-header-description: The proposal suggests that the article can be deleted uncontroversially, even though it doesn't meet the stricter and more challenging criteria required for speedy deletion.
adiutor-pmr-header-description: This window allows requests to move pages to another title. Typically, autoconfirmed users can perform page moves using the Move action link on pages.
adiutor-afd-header-description: The initiation of a discussion for the deletion of the page, even though it doesn't meet the stricter and more challenging criteria required for speedy deletion.
adiutor-tag-header-description: Now {{GENDER:|you}} are tagging this article. {{GENDER:|You}} can select maintenance or other type of tags from the list below that {{GENDER:|you}} want to add to this article.
adiutor-localization-settings-has-been-u: Adiutor localization settings have been updated.
adiutor-no-namespace-reason-for-csd-titl: No speedy deletion reason specified for this namespace.
adiutor-no-namespace-reason-for-csd: Please select one of the general reasons on the right.
adiutor-select-speedy-deletion-reason: You must select at least one speedy deletion reason.
adiutor-article-tagging-description: This page provides you with the ability to customize the settings of Adiutor's article tagging module. When you make adjustments here, it directly updates the configuration stored in the MediaWiki:AdiutorArticleTagging.json page on your behalf. You can easily track and review the history of your modifications on that page.
adiutor-multiple-issues-template-descrip: When activated, if more than one tag is added to an article, it puts them in a multi-issue template.
adiutor-multiple-issues-template-help-te: This template will be added to other templates for requests with multiple issues.
adiutor-uncategorized-template-help-text: Template to be added to the uncategorized article.
adiutor-create-speedy-deletion-configura: This page provides you with the ability to customize the settings of Adiutor's request speedy deletion module. When you make adjustments here, it directly updates the configuration stored in the MediaWiki:AdiutorCreateSpeedyDeletion.json page on your behalf. You can easily track and review the history of your modifications on that page.
adiutor-parameters-description: You can utilize the parameters within this options, which include:
adiutor-single-reason-template-descripti: This is a speedy deletion request template to be used for a single reason.
adiutor-multiple-reason-template-descrip: This is a speedy deletion request template to be used for a multiple reason.
adiutor-proposed-deletion-description: This page provides you with the ability to customize the settings of Adiutor's proposed deletion module. When you make adjustments here, it directly updates the configuration stored in the MediaWiki:AdiutorDeletionPropose.json page on your behalf. You can easily track and review the history of your modifications on that page.
adiutor-proposed-deletion-unsourced-blps: Proposed deletion of unsourced BLPs Template:
adiutor-proposed-deletion-template-descr: This is a proposed deletion request template to be used for a regular reason.
adiutor-proposed-deletion-blps-template: Proposed deletion of unsourced BLPs Template:
adiutor-proposed-deletion-blps-template-: This is a proposed deletion request template to be used for BLPs.
adiutor-request-page-move-description: This page provides you with the ability to customize the settings of Adiutor's request page protection module. When you make adjustments here, it directly updates the configuration stored in the MediaWiki:AdiutorRequestPageMove.json page on your behalf. You can easily track and review the history of your modifications on that page.
adiutor-content-pattern-description: In this field you can create the basic pattern of the content to be added to the page using the parameters specified above, you can use a preload templates in this field or you can also add regular templates.
adiutor-create-new-section: Create a new section on a new request queue.
adiutor-new-section-description: When this checkbox is enabled, a new section will be added to the noticeboard page.
adiutor-use-exist-section: Use exist section to append or prepend the content pattern.
adiutor-use-exist-section-description: When this checkbox is enabled, content will be added under the section specified in the section ID field.
adiutor-section-id-description: The content pattern will be prepended or appended in the section belonging to the ID specified here.
adiutor-no-section-description: If you do not create a new section or use an existing section, the content will be prepended or appended on the page.
adiutor-request-page-protection-descript: This page provides you with the ability to customize the settings of Adiutor's request page protection module. When you make adjustments here, it directly updates the configuration stored in the MediaWiki:AdiutorRequestPageProtection.json page on your behalf. You can easily track and review the history of your modifications on that page.
adiutor-csd-use-reason-value-description: When activated, only the reason value is inserted. It is mandatory to use the $3 parameter in the request template.
adiutor-csd-use-reason-data-description: When activated, only the reason data is inserted. It is mandatory to use the $2 parameter in the request template.
adiutor-csd-use-vertical-bar-description: When activated, reasons within the speedy deletion template are separated by a vertical | bar.
adiutor-csd-default-description: When activated, reasons within the speedy deletion template are separated by and.
adiutor-prepend-text-on-the-page-descrip: When this checkbox is activated, the specified content in the content pattern input will be prepended on the page.
adiutor-append-text-on-the-page-descript: When this checkbox is activated, the specified content in the content pattern input will be appended to the page.
adiutor-module-enabled-description: When this switched on, the module will be enabled.
adiutor-test-mode-description: When this switched on, this module can only be tested by interface administrators.
adiutor-namespaces-description: You can specify the namespaces where this module will be active.
adiutor-no-tag-found: No maintenance tag matches your search.
adiutor-prd-rationale-placeholder: Why are {{GENDER:|you}} proposing this article for deletion?
adiutor-proposed-deletion-blpprod-policy: Proposed deletion of unsourced BLPs policy
Proposed deletion of unsourced BLPs policy shortcut
adiutor-copy-vio-reason-value-descriptio: Enter a reason value that will trigger the display of the copyright-infringing page input.
adiutor-copy-vio-reason-value-help-text: Please remember that the template should have a 'url=' parameter.
adiutor-this-page-deleted-before: This page has been deleted $1 times before!
tag-adiutor-description: This edit has been made using the Adiutor extension.
adiutor-csd-enable-help: When this checkbox is activated, the speedy deletion request module will be enabled.
adiutor-rpp-enable-help: When this checkbox is activated, the protection request module will be enabled.
adiutor-rpm-enable-help: When this checkbox is activated, the page move request module will be enabled.
adiutor-prod-enable-help: When this checkbox is activated, the propose deletion module will be enabled.
adiutor-tag-enable-help: When this checkbox is activated, the article tagging module will be enabled.
adiutor-interface-admin-required: This action requires the interface-admin right.
adiutor-notification-body-csd-requested: Speedy deletion has been requested for $1 per our policy.
echo-pref-tooltip-moderation: Notify me about the moderations that concern me.
adiutor-protection-policy-title-help: This is the protection policy page title.
adiutor-report-revision-configuration-de: This page provides you with the ability to customize the settings of Adiutor's report revision module. When you make adjustments here, it directly updates the configuration stored in the MediaWiki:AdiutorReportRevision.json page on your behalf. You can easily track and review the history of your modifications on that page.
adiutor-revision-deletion-policy-title-h: This is the revision deletion policy page title.
adiutor-revision-reporting-warning: Prior to using this tool to make a request, the user should be informed about Wikipedia rules. In cases involving offensive edits or threats, a request can be made without following the notification procedure.
adiutor-rev-enable-help: When this checkbox is activated, the revision reporting module will be enabled.
adiutor-rev-incomplete-request-details: Please ensure you have selected a rationale and provided a comment.
